name: Hacker News RSS
tagline: Custom RSS feeds for Hacker News
body:
# hnrss — Hacker News RSS

hnrss provides custom, realtime RSS feeds for Hacker News.

## Feeds

The following feeds are available:

- **Firehose** — Every new [post](http://hnrss.org/newest) and [comment](http://hnrss.org/newcomments) as it arrives
- **Points** — [Posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?points=300) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/newcomments?points=25) with more than N points
- **Activity** — [Posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?comments=250) with more than N comments
- **Self-posts** — All "[Ask HN](http://hnrss.org/ask)" and "[Show HN](http://hnrss.org/show)" posts, along with [polls](http://hnrss.org/polls)
- **Users** — New [posts](http://hnrss.org/submitted?id=tokenadult) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/threads?id=tptacek) made by a given user
- **Threads** — Each new comment made [in a given thread](http://hnrss.org/item?id=7864813)
- **Searches** — New [posts](http://hnrss.org/newest?q=git) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/newcomments?q=django) matching a given search term

### Firehose

The "firehose" feeds contains all new [posts](http://hnrss.org/newest) and [comments](http://hnrss.org/newcomments) as they appear on Hacker News.

### Points

Maybe you like the idea of the firehose, but want to slow it down just a *bit.* You can do that with the `?points=X` filter. With this filter added on to a firehose feed, only posts or comments with more than X points will be included.

So, for example, here's a feed of [posts with 200+ points](http://hnrss.org/newest?points=200) and [comments with 100+ points](http://hnrss.org/newcomments?points=100).

#### Caveat: Comments and the points filter

There is one thing you should know when using the points filter on comments: It takes five days for point values on comments to be accurately reported via the Algolia API. What this means is there is a five day delay between when a comment is posted and when it shows up in an RSS feed when using the points filter.

This is a [known issue](https://github.com/algolia/hn-search/issues/29#issuecomment-41527957). My guess is the volatile nature of comment voting makes it more trouble than its worth to report a comment's realtime points value.

**Note:** [The comments firehose](http://hnrss.org/newcomments) itself doesn't have this limitation, its only when using the points filter.

### Activity

Similar to the points filter, you can also filter posts based the number of comments it has.

For example, here's an RSS feed with [all posts containing 25+ comments](http://hnrss.org/newest?comments=25).

### Self-posts

More and more people are turning to Hacker News to ask questions and show off their projects.

hnrss provides feeds for [all "Ask HN" posts](http://hnrss.org/ask) and [all "Show HN" posts](http://hnrss.org/show) along with all [polls](http://hnrss.org/polls) as they appear on the site.

### Users

After reading Hacker News for awhile, you begin to recognize certain usernames. So if you enjoy patio11's business advice, or tptacek's crypto knowledge, or Matt_Cutts's take on web spam and don't want to miss what they have to say, subscribe to their RSS feed.

- For an RSS feed with both posts and comments: `/user?id=USERNAME`
- For an RSS feed with just posts: `/submitted?id=USERNAME`
- For an RSS feed with just comments: `/threads?id=USERNAME`

### Threads

If there's some thread you're particularly interested in, you can subscribe to an RSS feed with new comments in that thread at `/item?id=THREAD_ID`

### Searches

Say you're a Django developer and want an RSS feed with every post and/or comment mentioning Django.

To filter on a search query, pass `?q=SEARCH_TERM` to any of the above feeds.

So, for all new posts mentioning Django: `/newest?q=Django`.

You can also do the same for new comments via `/newcomments?q=Django`.

## URL structure

All of the feeds try to mirror aspects of the Hacker News website. You'll see this reflected in the URL structure.

## Credits

hnrss is powered by [Algolia](https://hn.algolia.com/api), the
[official Hacker News API provider](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=7547578).
